Description: Complete Scaraboid, made of glazed steatite. Grey steatite and remains of a white glaze. The glaze is rubbed off at the highest part of the back as well as at the edges of the perforation. The shape of the scaraboid is oval in ground shape and half circular in section like a cowrie shell. The seal at the base shows an oval line framing the base. Inside Nb-MAa.t-Ra, throne name of Amenhotep III but not in a cartouche. The orientation of the seal is longitudinal as is the perforation.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), E13.2P, found well above early floor, in crack in east wall of P, near junction with N. It is therefore of no value for dating the P stratum.
Bibliographic references: Spencer 1997 / Amara West I, The Architectural Report (p. 25)
